SEARCH
Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.mime

Interface MIMEHandler

All Known Subinterfaces:
MessageHandler
All Known Implementing Classes:
DMARCMessageHandler
public interface MIMEHandler
Receive notification of the logical content of a MIME entity. This is the main interface that a MIME processor implements: it will register an implementation of this interface with the parser to be notified of parsing events.

A MIME entity consists of headers followed by a body. The body may contain nested entities if this is a multipart content type. The headers for each entity always precede the body content.

The structured MIME headers (Content-Type, Content-Disposition, Content-Transfer-Encoding, Content-ID, Content-Description, MIME-Version) are reported via dedicated callback methods. The parser handles these headers and the base MIMEHandler interface ignores any other headers.

Body content will be reported after an invocation of endHeaders(). The content may be expected or unexpected. Normal body content in a well-formed entity will be reported via the bodyContent() method, whereas content that occurs outside the correct MIME boundaries will be reported via unexpectedContent(), for analysis purposes.

Author:
Chris Burdess
See Also:
  • RFC 2045
  • RFC 2046

  • Method Details

    • setLocator

      void setLocator(MIMELocator locator)
      Receive an object for the location of MIME parsing events. This method will be called once prior to any other events. The handler can examine the locator when it receives any event and be informed of the end position of the event.
      Parameters:
      locator - the object for event parsing location information

    • startEntity

      void startEntity(String boundary) throws MIMEParseException
      Receive notification of the beginning of a MIME entity. For the root entity, the boundary parameter will be null. For nested entities in a multipart body, the boundary parameter will be the MIME boundary string that started this entity.
      Parameters:
      boundary - the MIME boundary that started this entity, or null for the root entity
      Throws:
      MIMEParseException - if the processor encountered a fatal condition during parsing and wishes to cancel the parse process

    • contentType

      void contentType(ContentType contentType) throws MIMEParseException
      Receive notification of a Content-Type header in the current entity.
      Parameters:
      contentType - the structured content type value
      Throws:
      MIMEParseException - if the processor encountered a fatal condition during parsing and wishes to cancel the parse process

    • contentDisposition

      void contentDisposition(ContentDisposition contentDisposition) throws MIMEParseException
      Receive notification of a Content-Disposition header in the current entity.
      Parameters:
      contentDisposition - the structured content disposition value
      Throws:
      MIMEParseException - if the processor encountered a fatal condition during parsing and wishes to cancel the parse process

    • contentTransferEncoding

      void contentTransferEncoding(String encoding) throws MIMEParseException
      Receive notification of a Content-Transfer-Encoding header in the current entity. The argument to this method will be a token, either one of the 5 predefined ones (base64, quoted-printable, 8bit, 7bit, binary), or a string token beginning with "x-" i.e. an x-token. All tokens should be treated as case-insensitive although they will be provided here verbatim as they occur in the entity.
      Parameters:
      encoding - the content transfer encoding value
      Throws:
      MIMEParseException - if the processor encountered a fatal condition during parsing and wishes to cancel the parse process

    • contentID

      void contentID(ContentID contentID) throws MIMEParseException
      Receive notification of a Content-ID header in the current entity.
      Parameters:
      contentID - the structured content-id value
      Throws:
      MIMEParseException - if the processor encountered a fatal condition during parsing and wishes to cancel the parse process

    • contentDescription

      void contentDescription(String description) throws MIMEParseException
      Receive notification of a Content-Description header in the current entity. The description will have any RFC 2047 encoded words decoded.
      Parameters:
      description - the content description text
      Throws:
      MIMEParseException - if the processor encountered a fatal condition during parsing and wishes to cancel the parse process

    • mimeVersion

      void mimeVersion(MIMEVersion version) throws MIMEParseException
      Receive notification of a MIME-Version header in the current entity.
      Parameters:
      version - the MIME-Version value
      Throws:
      MIMEParseException - if the processor encountered a fatal condition during parsing and wishes to cancel the parse process

    • endHeaders

      void endHeaders() throws MIMEParseException
      Receive notification that all the headers in an entity have been parsed. There will be no more header events issued for this entity, although if there are nested entities in a multipart content then they will have their own header sections. The handler implementation can now expect one of:
      • bodyContent: for raw body content data for a non-multipart entity
      • startEntity: for a new nested entity if this is a multipart entity
      • endEntity: to terminate the current entity
      Throws:
      MIMEParseException - if the processor encountered a fatal condition during parsing and wishes to cancel the parse process

    • bodyContent

      void bodyContent(ByteBuffer data) throws MIMEParseException
      Receive notification of the byte content of an entity. This method will be called only if the entity is not a multipart content type. Multiple invocations of this method may occur before the end of the entity. The content has been decoded according to the Content-Transfer-Encoding. Appropriate action must still be taken to convert it to a suitable representation, such as using the charset parameter in a text/plain entity to convert byte data to character data.
      Parameters:
      data - a buffer containing the body content data, ready for reading
      Throws:
      MIMEParseException - if the processor encountered a fatal condition during parsing and wishes to cancel the parse process

    • unexpectedContent

      void unexpectedContent(ByteBuffer data) throws MIMEParseException
      Receive notification of unexpected body content. This is content that is:
      • at the start of a multipart entity where the first boundary would be expected (preamble), or
      • after the end boundary of a multipart entity (epilogue)
      Parameters:
      data - a buffer containing the body content data, ready for reading
      Throws:
      MIMEParseException - if the processor encountered a fatal condition during parsing and wishes to cancel the parse process

    • endEntity

      void endEntity(String boundary) throws MIMEParseException
      Receive notification that a MIME entity has been completely parsed. For the root entity, the boundary parameter will be null. For nested entities in a multipart body, the boundary parameter will be the MIME boundary string that ended this entity.
      Parameters:
      boundary - the MIME boundary that ended this entity, or null for the root entity
      Throws:
      MIMEParseException - if the processor encountered a fatal condition during parsing and wishes to cancel the parse process
